info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:10PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN TALLADEGA...SOUTH CENTRAL CALHOUN...SOUTHWESTERN CLEBURNE AND NORTHEASTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 609 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mount Cheaha, or near Oxford, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Munford, Hobson City, Grant Town, Anniston Regional Airport, Oxford Lake, Mount Cheaha, Bynum, Dearmanville, Camp Mac, Ironaton, Jenifer, Lake Chinnabee and Gunthertown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
